title: Find Maximum in Array
tests:
console.log(findMax([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])); // Expected output: 5
console.log(findMax([-10, -5, 0, 5, 10])); // Expected output: 10

title: Reverse String
code:
/* Write a function 'reverseString' that accepts
 a string and returns the string reversed. */
initialCode:
/* Write a function 'reverseString' that accepts
 a string and returns the string reversed. */
tests:
console.log(reverseString('hello')); // Expected output: 'olleh'
console.log(reverseString('JavaScript')); // Expected output: 'tpircSavaJ'

title: Sum Array
solution: function sumArray(arr) { return arr.reduce((acc, curr) => acc + curr, 0); }
tests:
console.log(sumArray([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])); // Expected output: 15
console.log(sumArray([-10, -5, 0, 5, 10])); // Expected output: 0

title: Palindrome Checker
code:
/* Write a function 'isPalindrome' that accepts
 a string and returns true if the string is a
 palindrome (reads the same forward and backward),
 and false otherwise. */
initialCode:
/* Write a function 'isPalindrome' that accepts
 a string and returns true if the string is a
 palindrome (reads the same forward and backward),
 and false otherwise. */
solution: function isPalindrome(str) { const cleanStr = str.replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/g, '').toLowerCase(); return cleanStr === cleanStr.split('').reverse().join(''); }
tests:
console.log(isPalindrome('A man, a plan, a canal, Panama')); // Expected output: true
console.log(isPalindrome('hello')); // Expected output: false

title: Factorial Calculation
code:
/* Write a function 'factorial' that accepts
 a number and returns the factorial of that number.
 The factorial of a non-negative integer n is the
 product of all positive integers less than or equal to n. */
initialCode:
/* Write a function 'factorial' that accepts
 a number and returns the factorial of that number.
 The factorial of a non-negative integer n is the
 product of all positive integers less than or equal to n. */
solution: function factorial(n) { if (n <= 1) return 1; return n * factorial(n - 1); }
tests:
console.log(factorial(5)); // Expected output: 120
console.log(factorial(0)); // Expected output: 1
